title: Nri Kingdom Flourishes
description: The Nri Kingdom, a center of religion and culture, influences much of Igboland.
story: The Nri Kingdom is considered the cradle of Igbo civilization, known for its peaceful expansion, spiritual leadership, and the Ozo title system. Nri priests traveled across Igboland, spreading customs and resolving disputes.

title: Arochukwu Oracle Influence
description: The Arochukwu Oracle and Ekpe society play major roles in regional politics and trade.
story: The Arochukwu Oracle (Ibini Ukpabi) was a powerful spiritual and judicial center. The Ekpe society, with its secret codes and Nsibidi writing, connected communities and regulated trade, including the slave trade.

title: British Colonization
description: British colonial rule disrupts traditional Igbo structures.
story: The British imposed indirect rule, undermining Igbo republicanism and traditional councils. New taxes, forced labor, and missionary activities changed the social fabric.

title: Aba Women's Riots
description: Igbo women protest colonial policies in the famous Aba Women's Riots.
story: Thousands of women organized massive protests against unfair taxation and colonial authorities. The movement, also called the Women's War, is a landmark in African women's resistance.

title: Nigeria's Independence
story: The Igbo played key roles in Nigeria's independence movement. Early post-independence years saw Igbo leaders in prominent national positions, but ethnic tensions soon escalated.

title: Biafran War
description: The Biafran War deeply affects Igbo society and identity.
story: After a series of coups and massacres, the Eastern Region declared independence as Biafra. The war led to immense suffering, famine, and loss, but also forged a strong sense of Igbo identity and resilience.

title: Modern Igbo Culture & Diaspora
description: Revival of Igbo language, culture, and global diaspora efforts.
story: Today, the Igbo are known for entrepreneurship, vibrant culture, and a growing global diaspora. There are renewed efforts to teach Igbo language, celebrate festivals, and connect with roots worldwide.
